awd_titl_txt: Purchase of Fluid Inclusion Stage/Microscope for Sandstone  Diagenesis Studies
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides funds for 67% of the costs of acquiring                a microscope system with a heating/cooling stage for the study of               microscopic fluid inclusions in geological samples. The fluid                   inclusion system will be used by researchers in the Department of               Geological Sciences at Case Western Reserve University. The                     University is to provide the remaining 33% of the costs.                             The Case Western Reserve University Department of Geological               Sciences has a research program in sandstone diagenesis aimed at                determining quantitatively the conditions and timing of the                     different stages of sandstone formation. The study of fluid                     inclusions in sandstone provides an independent and direct way to               determine the temperature and salinity of the waters trapped                    during formation.
